com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.server
Class TaskQueue

java.lang.Object
  com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.server.TaskQueue

public final class TaskQueue
extends Object

A thread-safe reader/writer of the SJQv4 TaskQueue

This class provides thread-safe access to the SJQv4 task queue. Within the SJQ server code, this is the class to use for manipulating the task queue. Other JVMs cannot use this class to manipulate the task queue as it does not synchrnoize across processes! If you're trying to manipulate the task queue in another JVM, perhaps from a task client, then you must use the ServerClient class, which interacts with the task queue through a socket connection, which is properly synchronized across multiple processes.

If you interact with the task queue via this class in an external JVM then all bets are off - weird, unexpected things are probably going to happen to your task queue!

Eventually I'll come back and remove the public access to this class, but for now it's too convenient for me instead of forcing the app itself to also go through the socket server.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
dbattams

Update a task in the queue; all fields of the object are saved to the data store

Returns:
